DOC.brief_summary: Spinal anesthesia widely use procedure choice cesarean delivery . In comparison epidural anesthesia faster , easy perform , patient comfortable , complication rate low , cost effective . Spinal anesthesia accept technique elective cesarean section . However , hypotension , result sympathectomy common problem , especially pregnant woman . Spinal block cause peripheral vasodilation venous pooling , may result maternal hypotension . Maternal hypotension spinal anesthesia cesarean delivery , without prophylactic measure , high incidence ( 80 % -100 % ) . Even though highly investigate , spinal induced hypotension remain major concern , refer `` Holy Grail '' obstetric anesthesia . The detrimental effect spinal induced hypotension maternal fetal . Maternal effect nausea , vomit dizziness . Hypotension result reduce uterine intervillous blood flow potential fetal hypoxia acidosis . Treatment prevention hypotension subject much investigation controversy . Prophylactic measure include : 1 ) leave lateral tilt , 2 ) fluid preload , 3 ) vasopressors,4 ) low dose spinal anesthesia . A 15° left lateral tilt use routinely cesarean section , prevent aorto-caval compression , however sufficient sole method . Left uterine displacement achieve tilt operate table place wedge woman 's hip . Aorto-caval compression also may increase spread spinal anesthesia . Among non-pharmacological intervention study minimize incidence hypotension sit patient 7 min CSE anesthesia cesarean section reduce intraoperative ephedrine requirement without affect success spinal anesthetic . In contrast , sit 9 min result need rescue epidural anesthesia without additional benefit . Phenylephrine Treatment vascular failure shock , shock-like state , drug-induced hypotension hypersensitivity ; correction paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia ; prolongation spinal anesthesia ; vasoconstriction regional analgesia ; maintenance adequate level BP spinal inhalation anesthesia . It number important attribute treat spinal hypotension : ( ) alpha-adrenergic agonist , mechanism action directly address decrease systemic vascular resistance follow spinal anesthesia ; ( ii ) phenylephrine faster onset action compare ephedrine ; ( iii ) ephedrine associate ﬁve-fold increase risk fetal acidosis ; ( iv ) ephedrine likely cross placenta increase concentration lactate , glucose , catecholamine fetal circulation compare phenylephrine . However , phenylephrine use alone may accompany maternal bradycardia beneﬁt widespread clinical experience , ephedrine . Thus , phenylephrine yet become popular , particularly prophylactic use . Clinical experience suggest phenylephrine may useful addition ephedrine latter fail correct hypotension . Ephedrine sulphate potent sympathomimetic stimulates α β receptor clinical us related action . Its peripheral action , owes part release norepinephrine , simulate response obtain adrenergic nerve stimulate . These include increase blood pressure , stimulation heart muscle , constriction arteriole .
DOC.detailed_description: Study design : A prospective randomized clinical double-blind study use computer generate randomization conduct Women 's Health Hospital , Assuit University . Neither doctor `` investigator '' participant `` parturient '' aware group allocation drug use . The study drug prepare one supervisor anesthetist ( included procedure , observation data collection ) . The study carry 100 parturient schedule elective cesarean section spinal anesthesia . They randomly allocate two equal group 50 parturient : P group : Phenylephrine 30 µg/minute syringe pump infusion for30 min . E group : Ephedrine 3 mg/ minute syringe pump infusion for30 min . The study solution ( vasopressor ) prepare another supervisor anesthetist dilute normal saline ( Na Cl 0.9 % ) total 50 ml volume syringe pump . Pre-intervention Assessment : All parturient undergo full pre-anesthetic checkup ( accord ASA guideline ) include detailed history , physical systemic examination . They keep NOP ( nil per mouth ) 6-8 hour solids 2 hour water clear fluid . Parturient hold area : Baseline monitoring reading maternal vital sign include HR , NIBP , SpO2 RR . Non-invasive Cardiac Output Monitoring : The patient position supine position , uterine displacement leave lateral several minute electrode noninvasive cardiac output monitor place measure cardiac output . Baseline read cardiac output record intervention use NCCOM3 cardiodynamic monitor . . From apparatus get HR , EF , CO /CI , SVR Uterine blood flow evaluation : Baseline uterine blood flow record hold area intervention use SONO Ace R5 obstetric supervisor . Colour Doppler ultrasound use demonstrate main ascending branch leave right uterine artery cross hypogastric vessel enter uterus uterine-cervical junction . A third monitoring reading vital data , maternal non-invasive cardiac output uterine blood flow take 15 minute spinal block surgical operation ( cesarean section ) start . Intra-operative Assessment : After subarachnoid block monitor HR , NIBP , SpO2 RR every 5 minute till end surgery . The difference uterine blood flow index Doppler 2 . The difference intraoperative maternal vital singe . 3 . The rate occurrence neonatal morbidity . 4 . Complications side effect medication . 5 . Parturient satisfaction . Statistical analysis : Data collect analyzed use SPSS version 20 ( SPSS , Inc. , Chicago , Illinios , USA ) . Normally distributed numerical data present mean +_SD , rang , number percentage . Numerical variable compare among three group use Kruskal-Wallis test Mann-Whitney test . Categorical variable compare among three group use Chi-Square test Fisher 's exact test . P-value le 0.05 consider significant .
DOC.criteria: Age : 2035 year . ASA physical III Singleton term pregnancy . Elective cesarean section . Parturient refusal . Women history cardiac , respiratory , renal , neurologic endocrine disease . Women know allergy amide local anesthetic medication use study . Any contraindication regional anesthesia e.g . coagulopathy . Preeclampsia . Fetal abnormality . Emergency surgery . Failed unsatisfactory spinal block .
